description: Daria Tomenko discreetly accesses the dormant Halden protocol, weighing its potential for restoring control against the risks of manipulation.

After a brief, tense consultation with a trusted colleague, Daria erases Halden’s covert protocol from Council systems and redirects its library of handwritten diary fragments to the network controlling public billboards.
A major central square's digital display malfunctions, broadcasting Halden's cryptic handwritten diary entries. Crowds gather, drawn by the eerie accuracy of the diary’s predicted city disruptions.

Debate erupts across public spaces as citizens attempt to interpret the messages—dividing between those who see coded resistance and those who fear hidden threats. Spontaneous assemblies form, monitored by nervous local authorities.

Council emergency session debates destroying the diary broadcasts and restricting analog communication as the BCI experiences unpredictable scoring drops among protest gatherings, stoking public panic and unrest.
